alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: High Wind Warning issued April 12 at 9:24AM MDT until April 12 at 7:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM MDT /8 PM CDT/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Southwest winds at 30 to 50 mph with gusts up to 65 mph, shifting to the northwest during the afternoon. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and west central Kansas and east central Colorado. This includes the Interstate 70 corridor from Flagler, Colorado to Quinter, Kansas. * WHEN...Until 7 PM MDT /8 PM CDT/ this evening. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions associated with strong winds and blowing dust, especially on major routes such as Interstate 70, Highway 83, and Highway 283. Wind of this magnitude may also down trees, power lines, and damage property. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Near the Colorado border, winds will shift to the northwest by early afternoon. In northwest Kansas, the northwesterly wind shift will occur during the mid to late afternoon.
info.instruction: If you must drive, watch for objects blowing across the roadway and into your path. Keep a safe distance from cars in adjacent lanes as strong gusts could suddenly push a vehicle outside its lane of travel. Take extra care in high-profile vehicles such as a truck, van, or SUV, or when towing a trailer, as these are more prone to be pushed or even flipped by high winds. High dust concentrations can aggravate asthma and cause respiratory problems, especially in children, the elderly, or those with pre-existing respiratory conditions. The Kansas Department of Health and Environment recommends taking preventative measures such as staying indoors or wearing protective breathing masks, if outside.
